-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckUsedPartitionSpace'

7.description:
Overrides the default behaviour of the plugin in case no check element is left for being checked (if all elements are filtered out for example).
Instead of returning `Unknown` the plugin will return `Ok` instead if this argument is set.
7.caption: IgnoreEmptyChecks

9.description: Allows to set Unknown partitions to Ok in case no metrics could be loaded.
9.caption: SkipUnknown

10.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
10.caption: Verbosity

3.description:
Used to specify a Warning threshold. This can either be a byte-value type like '10GB'
or a %-value, like '10%'
3.caption: Warning

2.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
2.caption: ThresholdInterval

4.description:
Used to specify a Critical threshold. This can either be a byte-value type like '10GB'
or a %-value, like '10%'
4.caption: Critical

6.description:
Used to specify an array of partitions to be excluded.
e.g. 'C:','D:'
6.caption: Exclude

5.description:
Used to specify an array of partitions to be included. If not set, the check expects that all not excluded partitions should be checked.
e.g. 'C:','D:'
5.caption: Include

8.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
8.caption: NoPerfData
